content.question: Shown above is a slope field for the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4259@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. If y = g(x) is the solution to the differential equation with the initial condition <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CB0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, then, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <munder> <mrow> <mi>lim</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi> </mrow> </munder> <mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4100@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is
